content.text: Several documentation updates have been made to improve the developer experience. The README.md has been updated with information about custom plugins (PR #3736), and the plugins.md file now includes details about custom plugins not in the registry (PR #3735). Additionally, documentation has been enhanced with a blog, showcase, changelog, and RSS features (PR #3729). The .env.example file was also updated to include raiinmaker (PR #4136).

Several new features have been implemented. The avatar stack has been enhanced (PR #4162), node_modules was added to .gitignore (PR #4161), Evt is now used instead of eventEmitter3 (PR #4149), and the API has been cleaned up (PR #4144).

Multiple bug fixes have been implemented to improve system stability. These include fixing grammar issues and adding a createVerifiableLogApiRouter guard (PR #3707), fixing the splitText function (PR #3653), resolving a PGlite migration issue (PR #4158), fixing cache interaction cursor and duplicate memory creation (PR #4155), addressing Twitter-related issues and server crashes (PR #4151), ensuring project plugins load first (PR #4150), and resolving database transaction deadlocks (PR #4142). Test files were also fixed according to comments in PR #4130 (PR #4152).
Other improvements include better Farcaster configuration handling (PR #4156), updating the temporary hardcoded v2 registry (PR #4153), and the addition of extensive UI tests (PR #4092).

categories.title: Recent Pull Requests in the elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text:
Several pull requests have been submitted to the elizaOS/eliza repository addressing various features and fixes:

- PR #3733 by Tony363 successfully implemented request functionality
- PR #3735 by Xayaan updated the plugins.md documentation to include information about custom plugins not in the registry
- PR #4149 by wtfsayo replaced eventEmitter3 with Evt for event handling
- PR #4151 by wtfsayo fixed issues with Twitter integration and resolved a double memory creation attempt that was causing server crashes
- PR #4162 by tcm390 enhanced the avatar stack functionality
- PR #4150 by wtfsayo fixed an issue related to project plugin loading order, specifically addressing starter project concerns

categories.title: Recent Issues in the Eliza GitHub Repository

content.text:
Several issues have been reported in the Eliza GitHub repository:

1. Issue #4164 requests clearer marking or removal of plugins that are not yet compatible with Eliza v2, as raised by user odysseus0.

2. Issue #4146 reports a problem with creating a Twitter client, filed by user tcm390.

3. Issue #4159 from user LinuxIsCool asks for guidance on how to run the Eliza CLI, indicating potential documentation gaps or user confusion about the command-line interface.

4. Issue #4143 proposes testing every command in the CLI documentation section, submitted by madjin. This appears to be a quality assurance task to ensure documentation accuracy.

The elizaos/eliza repository showed increased activity between March and April 2025. In early March (March 1-2), there were 7 new PRs with 5 merged and no new issues, with 16 active contributors. By early April (April 2-3), activity had increased significantly with 16 new PRs (14 merged), 7 new issues, and 18 active contributors. This represents a notable growth in both contributions and contributor engagement over this one-month period.
sources: From 2025-03-01 to 2025-03-02, elizaos/eliza had 7 new PRs (5 merged), 0 new issues, and 16 active contributors.
From 2025-04-02 to 2025-04-03, elizaos/eliza had 16 new PRs (14 merged), 7 new issues, and 18 active contributors.
